title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: David Thomas & Andrew Hunt
description: Your journey to mastery. A guide for software craftsmanship covering best practices, tips, and philosophies for becoming a better programmer.
review: A timeless classic that every developer should read. The advice is practical and actionable, covering everything from code organization to career development.

title: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship that teaches how to write code that is readable, maintainable, and elegant.
summary: Focuses on writing code that clearly expresses intent, with principles like meaningful names, small functions, and comprehensive testing.

title: Designing Data-Intensive Applications
author: Martin Kleppmann
description: The big ideas behind reliable, scalable, and maintainable systems. Explores the principles and trade-offs in distributed systems.
review: Incredibly comprehensive and well-written. Makes complex distributed systems concepts accessible and practical.

title: The Phoenix Project
author: Gene Kim, Kevin Behr & George Spafford
description: A novel about IT, DevOps, and helping your business win. Follows an IT manager's journey to save a failing project.
summary: Illustrates DevOps principles through a compelling narrative, showing how to improve flow, feedback, and continuous learning.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: Rules for focused success in a distracted world. Explores the power of distraction-free concentration.
review: Changed how I approach my work day. The strategies for minimizing distractions and maximizing focus are incredibly effective.
summary: Argues that the ability to focus without distraction is becoming increasingly rare and valuable in our economy.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones through tiny changes that deliver remarkable results.
review: Practical and immediately applicable. The 1% improvement framework is powerful for sustainable change.
